column4: hello anybody here? i want to install eclipse-cdt on my ubuntu but it says that some of the files are missing. do i continue or not? if not, where do i get the missing files? this seems to be happening for a lot of software for me. isnt it a good idea to remove the softwares from the list if files are missing?
At a minimum, I'd think you will need a functional development environment for eclipse or some of it's plugins.
Did you take note of which packages are claimed to be missing?
